summary: This bill, the Miracle on Ice Congressional Gold Medal Act, proposes awarding three Congressional Gold Medals to the members of the 1980 United States Olympic Men’s Ice Hockey Team. It recognizes their victory over the Soviet Union at the 1980 Winter Olympics, acknowledging its impact on national morale, inspiring generations, and transforming ice hockey in the United States. The bill details the medal design, disposition (Lake Placid Olympic Center, US Hockey Hall of Fame, US Olympic & Paralympic Museum), duplication options, and financial considerations.
